body.name: Shark WD101 HydroVac XL 3-in-1 Vacuum, Mop & Self-Cleaning System with Antimicrobial Brushroll* & Solution for Multi-Surface , Perfect for Hardwood, Tile, Marble, Area Rug & More, Corded, Navy

features: 3-IN-1 CLEANING : The Shark HydroVac XL corded multi-surface cleaner vacuums, mops and cleans itself at the same time to deep clean hard floors and clean area rugs..1200.0 watts
WET + DRY MESSES: The powerful suction and hydro mopping pulls in dirt and debris, wet messes, stains and grime to leave a streak-free, clean surface that you can walk on almost immediately.

STARTS CLEAN, STAYS CLEAN: The continuous self-cleaning system helps prevent dirt from being redeposited back on your floor and the antimicrobial brushroll* helps prevent odors and bacteria on the brushroll. *Brushroll treated with antimicrobial substance to preserve roller and resist bacterial odors on the brushroll.
MULTI-SURFACE CLEANING: Designed for all sealed hard floors including hardwood, tile, marble, laminate. It also removes surface dirt and odors from area rugs.

ELIMINATES ODORS: The Shark HydroVac 12 oz. Multi-Surface Concentrate with odor neutralizer technology instantly eliminates and prevents odor from reforming on floors and area rugs. Perfect for pet owners.

EASY CLEAN-UP: The debris filtration technology in the dirty water tank is designed to separate solids from liquids so you can quickly and easily empty the tank. Place the HydroVac on its tray after every use and activate self-clean mode so it is clean and ready for the next use.
EXTRA LARGE CLEAN TANK: The intelligently designed system in the XL clean tank combines smart suction and flow control to maximize cleaning efficiency.
LED DISPLAY: Seamlessly transition between floor types with the touch of a button on the LED display that also provides surface type and tank levels.
LED HEADLIGHTS: Help you find the hidden dirt and grime for fast, efficient hard floor and area rug cleaning without missing a spot.

WHAT'S INCLUDED: Shark HydroVac XL Corded 3-in-1 multi-surface cleaner, 1 12oz multi-surface concentrate, 1 antimicrobial brushroll*, 1 foam filter and 1 storage tray. Ensure the Hydrovac is plugged in and place it on the storage tray to run a self-clean cycle. *Brushroll treated with antimicrobial substance to preserve roller and resist bacterial odors on the brushroll.
body.description: Shark HydroVac XL WD101 vacuums, mops, and cleans itself with powerful suction & hydro mopping at the same time for deep multi-surface cleaning. Perfect for hardwood floors, tile, marble, area rugs & more. Features a self-cleaning, antimicrobial brushroll* that helps prevent odors & bacterial growth on the brushroll; 2-tank system to separate clean & dirty water; and headlights to see hidden dirt and debris. Easily deep clean your hard floors and area rugs with the Shark HydroVac. *Brushroll treated with antimicrobial substance to preserve roller and resist bacterial odors on the brushroll.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This Shark vacuum/mop is awesome! I love that it vacuums and mops in ONE step. And that it constantly uses clean water. First time I used it the dirty water bin was like chocolate milk and it has only been about 12 days since I mopped with the Bona pad. I was vacuuming and then mopping separately. I was using the pad that I would have to run under water several times. So this new vacuum/mop saves time and gets my floors cleaner. I love it! Only complaint is that it does not get right up to the floor board/trim. There is about an inch or less space that I can see did not get wet right close to the floor board/trim.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use and maintain; effective cleaning performance
reviews.reviewText: I couldn’t decide between the corded Hyrovac and the corded Bissell Crosswave until I saw a head-to-head comparison video of the two on Vacuum Wars. The key points that swayed my decision to the Hydrovac were the much easier filter cleaning, the easier self-cleaning, the better/smoother swivel action, and the fact that, despite less raw power, the effective cleaning ability was a draw between the two. Add to that the much lower price for the Hydrovac and the decision was easy.So far I’ve been very pleased with this. It’s easy to use, does a very nice job on tile floors, and is easy to maintain. The cons for me are mostly along the lines of build quality issues. For example, the filter holder is not all that sturdy, so you need to take care when opening it to not break the plastic tabs. But, I have two other Shark vacs, and while they both have some less than ideal build quality issues, neither has failed on me yet. So I’m hoping for an equally long life from this Hydrovac.You can use other cleaners in this provided they are low/no suds. The Shark cleaner works well, but it’s quite pricey. There are other equally good cleaners from Hoover, Bissell and commercial cleaners (such as Ludmark) that cost less per use and work just fine in the Hydrovac. You don’t want to use an acidic cleaner (such as vinegar) or any cleaner that has suds since those will damage the water pump in the Hydrovac.It’s well worth picking up a spare set of filters and rollers. While the roller gets pretty well cleaned in the self-clean cycle, it’s still worth giving it a good hand wash. Plus, it’s not recommended to store the machine with a wet roller or wet filter to prevent mold/mildew. If you have spares you can swap out the wet ones for dry ones, and let the wet ones air dry.The Hydrovac has cut down on my cleaning time without any decrease in how clean the floors get. That’s worth five stars in my book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Didn't work straight out of the box - UPDATED
reviews.reviewText: UPDATED 2/7/23:So after my first purchase which didn't work out of the box, I bit the bullet and bought another, because I'd watched all the videos and remained convinced that this was the wet/dry mop I wanted. Not to mention, the Shark rep I'd contacted said this was the first time she'd seen this particular problem. I figured if Try #2 didn't work, I'd go to a different mop.I'm happy to say that as soon as I assembled the device and turned it on - it worked! So I went ahead and fully charged it.I've now used it over the entire house (except the carpeted areas). Here's my thoughts:1. Fully charged, the mop lasts maybe 25 minutes. This is enough for me to mop two large rooms and an area rug or two. If you have a big house (as I do), prepare to take several days to clean the whole thing. For me that's not a deal-breaker, I don't like to spend my whole day cleaning, so doing it in smaller chunks is really good. It took me four goes to get the entire house and all the area rugs.2. The clean water tank emptied or nearly emptied with every run. Maybe half the water ended up in the dirty water tank - and it was OPAQUE. So either my floors were horrifically dirty, or... okay, we'll just go with horrifically dirty floors. I haven't gone over any for a second pass so I'm not sure how much was left, but given how dark that water was, wouldn't shock me. I do feel as though the mop did a great clean, though - and the solution that came with it made the whole room smell very fresh.3. It's LOUD. I waited for my husband to walk the dog to run the mop. My dog heard the mop from the street and came racing back to save me. I set up the cleaning station in the basement behind two closed doors. I can hear the cleaning cycle through the closed doors from another floor in my house. LOUD.4. The cleaning solution dries very quickly. I was able to walk across a dried floor within a few minutes of having mopped it.5. I didn't have much trouble picking up small debris - tiny plastic wrapper corners, random hairs, small *small* bits of paper. Anything larger or more noticeable than a quarter, you'll want to pick up by yourself.6. I DID have trouble getting up dried stains. That Kool-Aid my kid spilled in the corner three days ago and didn't bother to tell me about or wipe up themselves? Nope. The mop got a lot of it, but not all. (Note to self: talk to kid.) Fresher stains (like the Kool-Aid I noticed from this morning but gleefully planned to pick up with the new mop) picked up just fine.TL:DR - Good mop, well worth the money, totally glad I tried again. I can see myself happily pulling this out for mopping every couple of weeks without too much fuss or heartache.That said, if you buy it... make sure it works the MINUTE you unbox it, but rest assured that if it doesn't, you can return it without too much trouble.ORIGINAL:I was so excited to receive this item; I unboxed it, plugged it in immediately to charge overnight (which the manual says is fine to do)... just to discover that it didn't work. Oh, the power turned on just fine, but the brush roller never spun, so I got an error message within ten seconds of trying to clean my floors. I couldn't even make the roller spin with my bare hands, it was STUCK, and for no discernable reason why, exactly as if some technician had tightened a screw too much. After a quick call to Shark's customer service - which I reached without trouble or wait - I was told my only option was to return it. The rep confirmed that the roller should have turned easily with my hands. (I have two other Shark vacuums, and both have rollers that turn with ease.)So, two stars because Shark's service reps were quick and helpful (they even set up a video link on my cell so they could see the vacuum in action!). I'll confirm that the vacuum was very light and would have been a breeze to use, if it'd worked.But docked three stars because it didn't work, and it should have, being brand-spanking-still-with0-the-stickers new. Considering that the manual also said that they test each vacuum before shipping... well, I kinda have to wonder if they really do that, because this seems like the thing they should have caught.I really wanted this device, but now I'm super nervous about ordering a replacement. I guess my floors will stay dirty a little while longer.

Muy buen producto, llegó antes de lo señalado, ahorra mucho tiempo y esfuerzo en la limpieza. El único pero que le encuentro es que el líquido concentrado no se encuentra a la venta y no sé si hay algún otro producto que pueda suplirlo...

Ya lo estrene, esta genial y muy fácil de armar y usar, limpio muy bien.Si no te gustas trapear, pero no te queda de otra, este es para ti, a mi no me gusta exprimir el trapeador, no tienes que bajar a tirar el agua sucia y enjuagar,( mi planta alta no tiene vertedero ) lo puedes hacer en cualquier lugar .
Très pratique à utilisé et à nettoyer après utilisation, juste le réservoir d'eau un peu petit pour faire toute la maison.
Una maravilla barrer, aspirar y trapear en una sola pasada, me gustó tanto que me compré otra para mi casa de fin de semana, 5 estrellas!
Me gusta, funciona muy bien.Solo que la pila dura muy poco y hay que vaciar el tanque constantemente y si esta fuera de su base el rodillo estila agua
